subject: biology
title: Human Circulatory System
description: Follow the journey of blood through the heart, arteries, veins, and capillaries in this immersive 3D lesson.

labSteps.title: The Heart
labSteps.instruction: The heart is a muscular pump divided into 4 chambers. Tap to see the chambers highlighted.
labSteps.expectedOutcome: Identify the four chambers: left/right atria and ventricles.

labSteps.title: Arteries
labSteps.instruction: Arteries carry oxygenated blood away from the heart (except pulmonary arteries). They have thick muscular walls.
labSteps.expectedOutcome: Distinguish arteries from veins by function and structure.

labSteps.title: Veins and Capillaries
labSteps.instruction: Veins return deoxygenated blood to the heart. Capillaries are microscopic vessels where gas exchange occurs. Rotate to see the network.
labSteps.expectedOutcome: Understand the role of each vessel type in circulation.

labSteps.title: Pulmonary vs Systemic Circulation
labSteps.instruction: Drag to trace both circulation pathways: pulmonary (heart→lungs→heart) and systemic (heart→body→heart).
labSteps.expectedOutcome: Explain the double circulation system in humans.

questions.question: How many chambers does the human heart have?
questions.explanation: The human heart has four chambers: right atrium, right ventricle, left atrium, and left ventricle.

questions.question: What do arteries typically carry?
options: Deoxygenated blood away from the heart
Oxygenated blood away from the heart
questions.correctAnswer: Oxygenated blood away from the heart
questions.explanation: Arteries carry oxygenated blood away from the heart to the body's tissues (the pulmonary arteries are the exception).

questions.question: Where does gas exchange between blood and tissue occur?
questions.explanation: Capillaries are microscopic blood vessels with very thin walls, allowing oxygen and nutrients to diffuse into tissues and CO2 to diffuse out.

questions.question: The pulmonary circulation carries blood between:
questions.explanation: Pulmonary circulation carries deoxygenated blood from the right side of the heart to the lungs and returns oxygenated blood to the left side.
